Difference between RL and SL

Basic ML Algorithms

Supervised learning: (ğ‘˜-)nearest neighbors

Rain Prediction Problem

Rain Prediction Problem â†’ Supervised Learning

  • Supervised learning: Input-output ìŒì˜ data setì´ ì£¼ì–´ì§€ë©´, inputì„ outputì— mappingí•˜ëŠ” í•¨ìˆ˜ë¥¼ í•™ìŠµ

Rain Prediction â†’ Supervised Learning â†’ Classification

  • Classification: Input pointë¥¼ discrete categoryë¡œ mappingí•˜ëŠ” í•¨ìˆ˜ë¥¼ í•™ìŠµí•˜ëŠ” supervised learning task

Nearest-Neighbor Classification

  • Nearest-neighbor classification: Inputì´ ì£¼ì–´ì§€ë©´, í•´ë‹¹ inputì—ì„œ ê°€ì¥ ê°€ê¹Œìš´ data pointì˜ classë¥¼ ì„ íƒí•˜ëŠ” ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜

kkk-Nearest-Neighbors Algorithm

  • kkk-nearest neighbors algorithm (kkk-NN)ì€ classificationê³¼ regression ëª¨ë‘ë¥¼ ìœ„í•œ non-parametric method
  • Input: Data setì—ì„œ kkkê°œì˜ ê°€ì¥ ê°€ê¹Œìš´ training example
  • Training exampleì€ ì¼ë°˜ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ë‹¤ì°¨ì› feature spaceì˜ vectorì´ë©°, ê°ê° class labelì„ ê°€ì§
  • Output
    • kkk-NN classification: Outputì€ class membership
    • kkk-NN regression: Outputì€ kkkê°œ nearest neighbors ê°’ì˜ í‰ê· 

Strengths and Weaknesses of kkk-NN Algorithm

  • ê°•ì 
    • Trainingì´ (ê±°ì˜) í•„ìš” ì—†ìŒ: ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ì˜ training phaseëŠ” training sampleì˜ feature vectorì™€ class labelì„ ì €ì¥í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒìœ¼ë¡œë§Œ êµ¬ì„±
    • ì´ê²ƒì´ non-parametric methodë¡œ ê°„ì£¼ë˜ëŠ” ì´ìœ 
  • ì•½ì 
    • ê¸°ë³¸ "majority voting" classificationì˜ ë‹¨ì ì€ class distributionì´ í¸í–¥(skewed)ë  ë•Œ ë°œìƒ
    • ì¦‰, ë” ë¹ˆë²ˆí•œ classì˜ exampleì´ ìˆ˜ê°€ ë§ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì— kkk nearest neighbors ì‚¬ì´ì—ì„œ ì¼ë°˜ì ì´ì–´ì„œ ìƒˆë¡œìš´ exampleì˜ ì˜ˆì¸¡ì„ ì§€ë°°í•˜ëŠ” ê²½í–¥
    • ì´ ë¬¸ì œë¥¼ ê·¹ë³µí•˜ëŠ” í•œ ê°€ì§€ ë°©ë²•ì€ test pointì—ì„œ ê° kkk nearest neighborsê¹Œì§€ì˜ ê±°ë¦¬ë¥¼ ê³ ë ¤í•˜ì—¬ classificationì— ê°€ì¤‘ì¹˜(weight)ë¥¼ ì£¼ëŠ” ê²ƒ (weighted nearest neighbors)

Unsupervised learning: ğ‘˜-means clustering

kkk-Means Clustering Algorithm

  • nnnê°œì˜ observation ë˜ëŠ” data point ì§‘í•© (x1,Â x2,Â â€¦,Â xn)(\mathbf{x}_1,~\mathbf{x}_2,~\dots,~\mathbf{x}_n)(x1â€‹,Â x2â€‹,Â â€¦,Â xnâ€‹)ì´ ì£¼ì–´ì¡Œì„ ë•Œ (ê° xi\mathbf{x}_ixiâ€‹ëŠ” ddd-ì°¨ì› vector), kkk-means clusteringì€ nnnê°œì˜ observationì„ k(â‰¤n)k(\le n)k(â‰¤n)ê°œì˜ ì§‘í•© S={S1,Â S2,Â â€¦,Â Sk}\mathbf{S} = \{S_1,~S_2,~\dots,~S_k\}S={S1â€‹,Â S2â€‹,Â â€¦,Â Skâ€‹}ë¡œ ë¶„í• í•˜ì—¬ WCSS (within-cluster sum of squares), ì¦‰ varianceë¥¼ ìµœì†Œí™”í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì„ ëª©í‘œë¡œ í•¨
  • ê³µì‹ì ìœ¼ë¡œ, ëª©í‘œëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒì„ ì°¾ëŠ” ê²ƒ:

argminâ¡Sâˆ‘i=1kâˆ‘xâˆˆSiâˆ¥xâˆ’Î¼iâˆ¥2 \underset{\mathbf{S}}{\operatorname{argmin}} \sum_{i=1}^{k} \sum_{\mathbf{x} \in S_i} \left\| \mathbf{x} - \boldsymbol{\mu}_i \right\|^2 Sargminâ€‹i=1âˆ‘kâ€‹xâˆˆSiâ€‹âˆ‘â€‹âˆ¥xâˆ’Î¼iâ€‹âˆ¥2

  • ì—¬ê¸°ì„œ Î¼i\boldsymbol{\mu}_iÎ¼iâ€‹ëŠ” SiS_iSiâ€‹ì— ìˆëŠ” pointë“¤ì˜ í‰ê· 
  • kkk-means ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ì€ Expectation-Maximization (EM) ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ì˜ instance
  • ì´ˆê¸° kkkê°œì˜ í‰ê·  ì§‘í•© Î¼1(1),Â â€¦,Â Î¼k(1)\boldsymbol{\mu}_1^{(1)},~\dots,~\boldsymbol{\mu}_k^{(1)}Î¼1(1)â€‹,Â â€¦,Â Î¼k(1)â€‹ì´ ì£¼ì–´ì§€ë©´, ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ì€ ë‘ ë‹¨ê³„ë¥¼ ë²ˆê°ˆì•„ ìˆ˜í–‰
  • Assignment (Expectation) step: ê° data pointë¥¼ ê°€ì¥ ê°€ê¹Œìš´ í‰ê· (least squared Euclidean distance)ì„ ê°€ì§„ clusterì— í• ë‹¹

    Si(t)={xp:âˆ¥xpâˆ’Î¼i(t)âˆ¥2â‰¤âˆ¥xpâˆ’Î¼j(t)âˆ¥2âˆ€j,Â 1â‰¤jâ‰¤k} S_i^{(t)} = \{ \mathbf{x}_p : \left\| \mathbf{x}_p - \boldsymbol{\mu}_i^{(t)} \right\|^2 \le \left\| \mathbf{x}_p - \boldsymbol{\mu}_j^{(t)} \right\|^2 \quad \forall j,~1 \le j \le k \} Si(t)â€‹={xpâ€‹:â€‹xpâ€‹âˆ’Î¼i(t)â€‹â€‹2â‰¤â€‹xpâ€‹âˆ’Î¼j(t)â€‹â€‹2âˆ€j,Â 1â‰¤jâ‰¤k}

  • Update (Maximization) step: ê° clusterì— í• ë‹¹ëœ data pointë“¤ì˜ (centroid) í‰ê· ì„ ë‹¤ì‹œ ê³„ì‚°

    Î¼i(t+1)=1âˆ£Si(t)âˆ£âˆ‘xpâˆˆSi(t)xp \boldsymbol{\mu}_i^{(t+1)} = \frac{1}{|S_i^{(t)}|} \sum_{\mathbf{x}_p \in S_i^{(t)}} \mathbf{x}_p Î¼i(t+1)â€‹=âˆ£Si(t)â€‹âˆ£1â€‹xpâ€‹âˆˆSi(t)â€‹âˆ‘â€‹xpâ€‹
